query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
1 Era già l’ora che volge il disio 2 ai navicanti e ’ntenerisce il core 3 lo dì c’han detto ai dolci amici addio;
query.error: **English:** 1 It was already the hour that turns the desire 2 of sailors to their homeland and softens the heart 3 on the day they have said farewell to their dear friends;
query.result: 1 An eur o veu an awel an awes 2 dhe'n morworyon ha'gas melys aga colon 3 an jorna ow thueth dheth dhe'n kesmeur ker.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
4 e che lo novo peregrin d’amore 5 punge, se ode squilla di lontano 6 che paia il giorno pianger che si more;
query.error: **English:** 4 and that pierces the new pilgrim of love 5 if he hears a bell tolling in the distance 6 that seems to mourn the dying day;
query.result: 4 Ha'gas an pilgrim nowydh a garow 5 ow klev bell ow toni a bell bell bell 6 owthueth an jorna ow mernans y'n mernans.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
7 quand’ io incominciai a render vano 8 l’udire e a mirare una de l’alme 9 surta, che l’ascoltar chiedea con mano.
query.error: **English:** 7 when I began to lose the power 8 of hearing and to gaze at one of the souls 9 who had emerged, asking to be heard with a gesture.
query.result: 7 Pan wrugof vy dhe'n klev ha'gas 8 ha sel yn un a'n eneow 9 ow tos ha'gas, ow hwilas dhe'y klev gans aga dorn.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
10 Ella giunse e levò ambo le palme, 11 ficcando li occhi verso l’orïente, 12 come dicesse a Dio: ‘D’altro non calme’.
query.error: **English:** 10 She arrived and raised both her palms, 11 fixing her eyes towards the east, 12 as if to say to God: ‘I care for nothing else’.
query.result: 10 Hi a dheuth ha'gas ha'y dhew dorn, 11 ow sel aga lagha dhe'n est, 12 avel orth y lavar dhe'n Duw: ‘Nyns yw erel aral’.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
13 ‘Te lucis ante’ sì devotamente 14 le uscìo di bocca e con sì dolci note, 15 che fece me a me uscir di mente;
query.error: **English:** 13 ‘Te lucis ante’ so devoutly 14 issued from her mouth and with such sweet notes, 15 that it made me lose myself in thought;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
16 e l’altre poi dolcemente e devote 17 seguitar lei per tutto l’inno intero, 18 avendo li occhi a le superne rote.
query.error: **English:** 16 and the others then sweetly and devoutly 17 followed her throughout the entire hymn, 18 keeping their eyes on the celestial spheres.
query.result: 16 ha'n erel a dheuth warbarth yn melyon ha devosith 17 ow sel hi a-dreus oll an hymn, 18 ow sel aga lagha dhe'n keth rosow a'n nef.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
19 Aguzza qui, lettor, ben li occhi al vero, 20 ché ’l velo è ora ben tanto sottile, 21 certo che ’l trapassar dentro è leggero.
query.error: **English:** 19 Sharpen your eyes well to the truth here, reader, 20 for the veil is now so thin, 21 that it is certainly easy to pass through it.
query.result: 19 Golgh aga lagha, lenner, dhe'n gwir yn ta, 20 rag an gwisk yw lemmyn kemmys tenow, 21 sur a wra es dhe'y tremena a-dreus yn es.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
22 Io vidi quello essercito gentile 23 tacito poscia riguardare in sùe, 24 quasi aspettando, palido e umìle;
query.error: **English:** 22 I saw that noble army 23 then silently look upwards, 24 as if waiting, pale and humble;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
25 e vidi uscir de l’alto e scender giùe 26 due angeli con due spade affocate, 27 tronche e private de le punte sue.
query.error: **English:** 25 and I saw two angels come out from above and descend, 26 with two flaming swords, 27 broken and deprived of their points.
query.result: 25 ha me a welas ow tos dhyworth an ughel ha'gas ow tiskedha, 26 dew angel gans dew cledhev ow flammow, 27 tronk ha prevez a'n ponsow aga.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
28 Verdi come fogliette pur mo nate 29 erano in veste, che da verdi penne 30 percosse traean dietro e ventilate.
query.error: **English:** 28 Green as newly born leaves 29 were they in robes that, beaten by green wings, 30 trailed and fluttered behind them.
query.result: 28 Gweres avel foeljynnow nowydh genys 29 o esens yn jyla, ow kelli gwynn 30 ow tos owthynna haval orth aga.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
31 L’un poco sovra noi a star si venne, 32 e l’altro scese in l’opposita sponda, 33 sì che la gente in mezzo si contenne.
query.error: **English:** 31 One came a little above us to stand, 32 and the other descended to the opposite bank, 33 so that the people in the middle held back.
query.result: 31 Onan a dheuth bys vy dhe sevel, 32 ha'n aral a dheuth dhe'n fordh erel, 33 marow an bobel a dheuth dhe sevel.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
34 Ben discernëa in lor la testa bionda; 35 ma ne la faccia l’occhio si smarria, 36 come virtù ch’a troppo si confonda.
query.error: **English:** 34 I could clearly make out their blond heads; 35 but my eyes could not see their faces, 36 like a faculty that is overwhelmed by too much.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
37 «Ambo vegnon del grembo di Maria», 38 disse Sordello, «a guardia de la valle, 39 per lo serpente che verrà vie via».
query.error: **English:** 37 “Both come from the womb of Mary,” 38 said Sordello, “to guard the valley, 39 because of the serpent that will come this way.”
query.result: 37 “Oll an dhew a dheuth a groth Mari”, 38 a leveris Sordello, “rag drehevel an dowr, 39 rag an sarf ow tos dhe'n fordh ma.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
40 Ond’ io, che non sapeva per qual calle, 41 mi volsi intorno, e stretto m’accostai, 42 tutto gelato, a le fidate spalle.
query.error: **English:** 40 Whereupon I, who did not know which way to go, 41 turned around and, trembling, drew close 42 to those trusted shoulders.
query.result: 40 Ha my, nag esa gowsys drehev fordh, 41 a drohwys yn-dro ha'gas ow tos dhe'n fordh, 42 oll rewlys, dhe'n skwyddys fydhys.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
43 E Sordello anco: «Or avvalliamo omai 44 tra le grandi ombre, e parleremo ad esse; 45 grazïoso fia lor vedervi assai».
query.error: **English:** 43 And Sordello again: “Now let us descend 44 among the great shades, and we will speak to them; 45 it will please them greatly to see you.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
46 Solo tre passi credo ch’i’ scendesse, 47 e fui di sotto, e vidi un che mirava 48 pur me, come conoscer mi volesse.
query.error: **English:** 46 I think I had descended only three steps, 47 and I was below, and I saw someone who was gazing 48 only at me, as if he wanted to recognize me.
query.result: 46 Tri gamm hepken a leveris ow tos dhe'n fordh, 47 ha my a veu a-woles, ha'gas a welas 48 vy hepken, avel orth ow tos ow cavas.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
49 Temp’ era già che l’aere s’annerava, 50 ma non sì che tra li occhi suoi e ’ miei 51 non dichiarisse ciò che pria serrava.
query.error: **English:** 49 It was already the time when the air was growing dark, 50 but not so much that between his eyes and mine 51 it did not reveal what it had previously concealed.
query.result: 49 An eur o veu panvow an ayr ow tos dhe'n fordh, 50 mes nag esa kemmys na dheuth ynter ylagas ha'y 51 na leveris an pyth ow tos ow tos dhe'n fordh.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
52 Ver’ me si fece, e io ver’ lui mi fei: 53 giudice Nin gentil, quanto mi piacque 54 quando ti vidi non esser tra ’ rei!
query.error: **English:** 52 He approached me, and I approached him: 53 noble Judge Ninus, how pleased I was 54 when I saw that you were not among the kings!
query.result: 52 Ev a dheuth dhe'm fordh, ha my a dheuth dhe'y fordh: 53 barnjur jentil Ninus, pyth ow lowena 54 panvow na veuvos orth ynter an reys!

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
55 Nullo bel salutar tra noi si tacque; 56 poi dimandò: «Quant’ è che tu venisti 57 a piè del monte per le lontane acque?».
query.error: **English:** 55 No courteous greeting was left unspoken between us; 56 then he asked: “How long is it since you came 57 to the foot of the mountain by the distant waters?”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
58 «Oh!», diss’ io lui, «per entro i luoghi tristi 59 venni stamane, e sono in prima vita, 60 ancor che l’altra, sì andando, acquisti».
query.error: **English:** 58 “Oh!” I said to him, “through the sorrowful places 59 I came this morning, and I am in my first life, 60 although I am acquiring the other as I go.”
query.result: 58 “Oh!”, a leveris dhe'y, “drehev an leow trysti 59 a dheuth hedhyw, ha my yn kynsa byw, 60 byttegyns an aral, avel orth ow tos dhe'n fordh, ow tos dhe'n fordh.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.

query.error: **English:** 61 And when my answer was heard, 62 Sordello and he drew back 63 like people suddenly bewildered.
query.result: 61 Ha pan vynedh agaghwedhel, 62 Sordello hag ev yn keffrys a-dhallathas 63 avel dus ow a-dhollas yn subet.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.

query.result: 64 An eyl orth Virgili hag egile orth unn 65 o osedha eno, ow kewsel: “Sef, Currado! 66 dos dhe wul Whelas dreus gras a wrug.”

Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
70 quando sarai di là da le larghe onde, 71 dì a Giovanna mia che per me chiami 72 là dove a li ’nnocenti si risponde.

query.result: 70 pan voseugh owth an tu-honna tonnow, 71 leverel dhe Giovanna dhe galvos orthof 72 eno le mayth an dus anedhagon an lavarow.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
73 Non credo che la sua madre più m’ami, 74 poscia che trasmutò le bianche bende, 75 le quai convien che, misera!, ancor brami.
query.error: **English:** 73 I do not believe that his mother loves me more, 74 since she changed the white robes, 75 which, poor woman, she must still desire.
query.result: 73 Nyns credaf vy na’y vamm a garo dhe’m moy, 74 wosa y hi throadh an gwynn wiskoedh, 75 an re beu dhe, an drus, hedhyw a gar.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
76 Per lei assai di lieve si comprende 77 quanto in femmina foco d’amor dura, 78 se l’occhio o ’l tatto spesso non l’accende.

query.result: 76 Dre y hi a yll vydh a-somprehendya 77 pyth pella yn benen tan tan a-bera 78 mar nas gwello po’th tevi nyns a-y tanna.

79 Non le farà sì bella sepultura 80 la vipera che Melanesi accampa, 81 com’ avria fatto il gallo di Gallura».

query.result: 79 Nyns wra gena dhe’y morvow kemmys vyth 80 an viber ow campa an Melanesi, 81 avel a wra gena an cawar a Galura».

Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
82 Così dicea, segnato de la stampa, 83 nel suo aspetto, di quel dritto zelo 84 che misuratamente in core avvampa.

query.result: 82 Henwys a leveris, merghys gans an stamp, 83 yn y edhom, a’n gywir sel 84 ow tanow yn mesur yn kalon a-losk.

query.prompt:

85 Li occhi miei ghiotti andavan pur al cielo, 86 pur là dove le stelle son più tarde, 87 sì come rota più presso a lo stelo.

query.result: 85 Agagh dhewghlow a-ytho pur dhe’n nef, 86 pur eno le mayth an steren a wra moyha, 87 avel rol moyha dhe’n astell.

88 E ’l duca mio: «Figliuol, che là sù guarde?». 89 E io a lui: «A quelle tre facelle 90 di che ’l polo di qua tutto quanto arde».
query.error: **English:** 88 And my leader: “My son, what are you looking at up there?”. 89 And I to him: “At those three torches 90 with which the pole here is all aflame”.
query.result: 88 Ha’m duga vy: “Fy mab, pyth eus ow tos orth?”. 89 Ha my a-ytho: “Orth an teyr torch 90 owth eus an pol owth ena oll a-losk”.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
91 Ond’ elli a me: «Le quattro chiare stelle 92 che vedevi staman, son di là basse, 93 e queste son salite ov’ eran quelle».
query.error: **English:** 91 Then he to me: “The four bright stars 92 that you saw this morning are down there now, 93 and these have risen where those were”.
query.result: 91 Wosa ev orthof: “An peswar steren kler 92 owth eus ow tos hedhyw a-mena, eus isella, 93 ha’n re ma wra sevel le mayth an re ollas”.

query.result: 97 A'n nessa tu, le mayth ripar, 98 an vale byghan, o ena gwiber, 99 marnas an onan a ro's dhe'n Eva an boes boes.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.

query.error: **English:** 100 Among the grass and flowers came the evil serpent, 101 turning its head and back from time to time, 102 licking itself like a beast that is grooming itself.
query.result: 100 Ynter an geyn ha'n bleujyn o ena an gwibra, 101 ow treylya y ben hag y keun, ha'y kein 102 ow laka del best owth omglewya.

query.result: 106 Ow klevos an ayr ow fetha gans aga eselyow gwyrdh, 107 fugas an sarf, ha’n angeledh a droas, 108 wartha dhe’n postow ow adrohedhes owth.

Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
